Class XMLRead

  • java.lang.Object
    • XMLRead
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    XMLTemplate

    public class XMLRead
extends java.lang.Object
implements XMLTemplate
    A class used to provide simple methods for downloading and extracting data from XML pages.
    Version:
    1.01 - 05/23/2014
    Author:
    Duy Pham
    See Also:
    Program Specification
    Email:
    pnad0911@gmail.com
    Prgm.usage:
    XMLRead xml = new XMLRead();
    Assignment.number:
    A19015

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private org.w3c.dom.Document document
      Once the XML file is read, it is stored in this object.
      private int intRecNum
      This is a class level variable that maintains the current record (node) number in use.

        intRecordPos

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      XMLRead()
      The constructor only initializes intRecNum equal to a minus one.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int find(java.lang.String strKeyName, java.lang.String strKeyContents)
      This function will search for a value represented by strKey in a field indicated by strKeyField.
      java.lang.String getField(java.lang.String strFieldName)
      This method extracts the contents of the field at the the current intRecNum position.
      java.lang.String getField(java.lang.String strField, int intRec)
      This method sets the current record to intRec and then extracts the contents of that field at that record.
      int getRecordCount(java.lang.String strFieldName)
      This method returns the number of records in the XML file after a getElementsByTagName() search
      void loadPage(java.lang.String strURL)
      This function accepts a URL to an XML page and stores it in a Document object.
      java.lang.String setTable(java.lang.String strTable)
      This function looks for a table name in the XML document and returns the first child node.
      void Status(java.lang.String strVar)
      This method is just used to display data during testing.

    • Field Detail

      • document

        private org.w3c.dom.Document document
        Once the XML file is read, it is stored in this object.

      • intRecNum

        private int intRecNum
        This is a class level variable that maintains the current record (node) number in use. It is set by find()and used by getField().

    • Constructor Detail

      • XMLRead

        public XMLRead()
        The constructor only initializes intRecNum equal to a minus one.

    • Method Detail

      • find

        public int find(java.lang.String strKeyName,
                java.lang.String strKeyContents)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        This function will search for a value represented by strKey in a field indicated by strKeyField.
        • intRecNum is set to a minus one if it did not find the key
        • intRecNum is set to the index number (position) if it did find the key.
        Specified by:
        find in interface XMLTemplate
        Parameters:
        strKeyName - - the field name to search
        strKeyContents - - the value of the field name to be searched
        Returns:
        integer - the record number(position) or a minus one if it did not find the key
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getField

        public java.lang.String getField(java.lang.String strFieldName)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        This method extracts the contents of the field at the the current intRecNum position.
        Specified by:
        getField in interface XMLTemplate
        Parameters:
        strFieldName - - the field name of the data you want to retrieve
        Returns:
        integer - the contents of the field
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getField

        public java.lang.String getField(java.lang.String strField,
                                 int intRec)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        This method sets the current record to intRec and then extracts the contents of that field at that record.
        Specified by:
        getField in interface XMLTemplate
        Parameters:
        strField - - the field name of the data you want to retrieve
        intRec - - the record number to use
        Returns:
        string - the contents of the field
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getRecordCount

        public int getRecordCount(java.lang.String strFieldName)
        This method returns the number of records in the XML file after a getElementsByTagName() search
        Specified by:
        getRecordCount in interface XMLTemplate
        Parameters:
        strFieldName - - this can be any field that is in the record
        Returns:
        integer - the number of records in that table

      • loadPage

        public void loadPage(java.lang.String strURL)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        This function accepts a URL to an XML page and stores it in a Document object. The class variable intRecNum is also set to -1.
        Specified by:
        loadPage in interface XMLTemplate
        Parameters:
        strURL - - URL to the XML page (can be local or over the Internet)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setTable

        public java.lang.String setTable(java.lang.String strTable)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        This function looks for a table name in the XML document and returns the first child node.
        Specified by:
        setTable in interface XMLTemplate
        Parameters:
        strTable - - the name of the root table
        Returns:
        string - returns the child node as a string
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • Status

        public void Status(java.lang.String strVar)
        This method is just used to display data during testing.
        Specified by:
        Status in interface XMLTemplate
        Parameters:
        strVar - - any string (it is displayed in the jGrasp messages window)
